articles.title: Korean People's Cause of Justice Supported in Denmark
articles.content:
Korean People's Cause of Justice Supported in Denmark 
    Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- The Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association participating in the commemorations of May Day held in Copenhagen under the sponsorship of the Communist Party of Denmark (Marxist-Leninist) conducted positive activities supporting the Korean people in their cause of justice.
 The association set a special site for introducing the DPRK in the venue of the function and hoisted the national flag of the DPRK and put on display famous works of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and books and handicrafts showing the true feature of Songun Korea and the wisdom and talents of the Korean nation.   
 Members of the association introduced the fair and principled stand of the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK government for reunification and peace of the country, waving national flags of the DPRK and slogan boards reading "We fully support independent and peaceful reunification of Korea", "U.S. troops, go out of south Korea" and so on.

articles.title: Unitary Front Body for Democratic Movement Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
Unitary Front Body for Democratic Movement Called for in S. Korea
 
    Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- South Korean dissidents reportedly held a meeting in Seoul on May 3, attended by representatives of civic and social organizations and overseas compatriots and called for forming a unitary front body of the national democratic movement camp.
 At the meeting the honorary chairman of the South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification and the co-representative of the Unification Rally underscored the urgency of the great unity of the national democratic movement camp and called upon dissidents to wage a struggle in the van of the ranks. .   
 A permanent adviser to the Federation of South Koreans in Japan for Democracy and Unification said that overseas Koreans are expecting the south Korean society to establish a unitary front body for wining the vital right of the people and achieving national reunification, stressing that they would take an active part in the struggle.

Authorities' Land Expropriation Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Land Expropriation Slammed in S. Korea
 
.    Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- Public organizations in south Korea reportedly issued statements on May 4 condemning the Defence Ministry and the police authorities for their expropriation of the land for the expansion of the U.S. military base in Phyongthaek. Among the organizations were the Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration, the Reunification Solidarity, the Federation of south Korean Trade Unions and the Federation of Peasants Associations.
 The statements held that the military forces' and policemen's brutal suppression of Phyongthaek inhabitants, members of civic organizations and students out in the protest has created a terror-ridden atmosphere reminiscent of Kwangju in May of 1980.
 In the statements the organizations declared that they would intensify the struggle until the plan for the expansion of the U.S. military base is cancelled. .

Ro Tu Chol Meets Chinese Government Delegation
articles.content:
Ro Tu Chol Meets Chinese Government Delegation
 
.    Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet, met and had a friendly conversation with the visiting government economic and trade delegation of China led by Ma Xiuhong, vice-minister of Commerce, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.
 On hand were Ri Ryong Nam, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, and Wu Donghe, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK and China Cooperate in Economy and Trade
articles.content:
DPRK and China Cooperate in Economy and Trade
 
.    Pyongyang, May 9 (KCNA) -- The second meeting of the DPRK-China Economic, Trade and Scientific and Technological Cooperation Committee was held at the People's Palace of Culture Tuesday.
 Present at the meeting were members of the DPRK government economic and trade delegation led by Vice-Minister of Foreign Trade Ri Ryong Nam and members of the Chinese government economic and trade delegation led by Vice-Minister of Commerce Ma Xiuhong and Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe. .   
 The meeting discussed issues of boosting the economic cooperation and trade relations between the two countries.
